DOC.brief_summary: Fluoxetine action on cerebral connectivity changes in acute ischemic stroke patients
DOC.brief_title: Serotonin Selective Reuptake Inhibitor (SSRI) Effects on Cerebral Connectivity in Acute Ischemic Stroke
DOC.detailed_description: In this placebo-controlled study, using functional resting state MRI, the investigators aim to investigate cerebral connectivity changes induced by fluoxetine given once a day for 90 days, in stroke patients with a moderate to severe motor deficit.
